column4: Hello...  have a tiny bit of an issue here, hopefully it'll be a simple one.
How does one go about manually restarting audio in Ubuntu 10.04?
then "sudo killall pulseaudio" .. it should restart by itself if not then "pulseaudio &"
No dice.  pulseaudio doesn't restart sound.
when did it stop...? after installing something?
Nope.  Didn't do a thing.  I only noticed it died when I sent an IM and no sound came up.
weird.. catastrophic sound card failure perhaps.. try aplay <music file> in terminal and see if it works with that
aplay is running but there's no sound.
I know this sounds silly but have you checked the jack going to the speaker? I've got a dog that likes to lay under my desk when I'm sitting there.. 70lbs on wires does things :)
that would preclude a pet pest... accidently hit the mute key?
It changes color when you touch it.  So... no.
click the speaker icon up by the clock and check out the preferences.. gotta cover all the bases.
I just tried cat trial.wav > /dev/dsp and there's no audio.
I'm stuck .. someone else will have to pick this up.
Yeah.  I was afraid of that... <_<
